meanings.sent1: She skarted across the room to catch the falling book.
meanings.sent2: The cat skarted out of the bushes when it heard a noise.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel skarted up the tree to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: The leaves skarted off the tree branches in the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The ball skarted down the hill, picking up speed.

meanings.sent1: His skart towards the door surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The skart of the car screeching to a halt caught our attention.
meanings.sent3: The skart of the falling vase made everyone gasp.
meanings.sent4: The skart of the lightning strike lit up the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The skart of the dancer's spin mesmerized the audience.

meanings.definition: A small, quick, or sudden movement
meanings.sent1: The skart of the mouse caught the cat's eye.
meanings.sent2: A skart of wind blew the hat off his head.
meanings.sent3: The skart of the butterfly's wings fascinated the children.
meanings.sent4: The skart of the fish darting away was a flash of silver.
meanings.sent5: The skart of the falling raindrops created a soothing sound.
